RainbruRPG::Terminal::ListBox

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The list box widget.

The listbox is set to render a list of text item. The user can select one or more item in the list. It can draw a caption. To disable the caption drawing ability, use setDrawCaption( bool );

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::ListBox::setDrawCaption ( bool  b  ) 

Turn on or off the ability to draw the ListBox caption.

This modify the drawCaption boolean directly and without any control.

Parameters:
b if true, the ListBox will draw its caption, otherwise, it will not draw it.

Definition at line 124 of file listbox.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::ListBox::draw ( int  x,
int  y 
) [virtual]

The pure virtual draw method.

Every widget must subclass this method to be able to draw itself. The Layout call it for every widget.

The parameters tells the widget the position of the Window wich contains the widget. They are set by the Layout::Draw() with the Layout::setOrigin( int, int ) method parameters.

Parameters:
x The position of the window
y The position of the window

Implements RainbruRPG::Terminal::Widget.

Member Data Documentation

bool RainbruRPG::Terminal::ListBox::drawCaption [private]

If true, draw the listBox caption.

By default, this property is set to true.

Definition at line 92 of file listbox.h.

bool RainbruRPG::Terminal::Widget::canTakeFocus [protected, inherited]

This boolean is used to know if the widget can have the focus.

We can access this value with the canHaveFocus() function.

All the subclass of Widget must set this property to true or false. Typically, a Label can not have the focus, otherwise, a ListBox or a LineEdit must be able to have the focus.

Definition at line 80 of file widget.h.

int RainbruRPG::Terminal::Widget::x [protected, inherited]

The x coordonate of the widget.

This value is relative to the window top-left corner and cannot be inferior to 0.
